11243Transition Metal ChemistryTransition Met Chem0340-42851572-901XKluwer Academic PublishersDordrechtPIPS65657710.1007/s11243-006-0077-2ArticleSynthesis, crystal structure and magnetism study on novel one-dimensional Cu(II) coordination polymers with 2,5-dimethylpyrazine-1,4-dioxide as bridging ligandShiJing-Min1aZhangFeng-Xia1WuChang-Ju1LiuLian-Dong1YiLong2grid.410585.dDepartment of ChemistryShandong Normal University250014JinanP. R. Chinagrid.216938.70000000098787032Department of ChemistryNankai University300071TianjinP. R. Chinashijingmin@beelink.com102006317879881240520060205200624052006© Springer 20062006Abstract

A novel one-dimensional coordination polymer [Cu(μ1,6-dmpzdo)(dmpzdo)2]·(ClO4)2 (dmpzdo = 2,5-dimethylpyrazine-1,4-dioxide) has been synthesized and its crystal structure determined by X-ray crystallography. In the complex each Cu1 atom is located in a square planar coordination environment with two oxygen atoms O2 and O2A from two dmpzdo terminal ligands, and two other oxygen atoms O3 and O3A from two μ1,6-dmpzdo bridging ligands. The one-dimensional chain is constructed by the coordination of a μ1,6-dmpzdo bridging ligand and Cu(II) ions. The data of the variable temperature (4–300 K) magnetic susceptibilities were fitted by using the one-dimensional chain fitting formula, which gave the magnetic coupling constants 2J = −98.88 cm−1.

elements.content: A novel one-dimensional coordination polymer [Cu(μ1,6-dmpzdo)(dmpzdo)2]·(ClO4)2 (dmpzdo = 2,5-dimethylpyrazine-1,4-dioxide) has been synthesized and its crystal structure determined by X-ray crystallography. In the complex each Cu1 atom is located in a square planar coordination environment with two oxygen atoms O2 and O2A from two dmpzdo terminal ligands, and two other oxygen atoms O3 and O3A from two μ1,6-dmpzdo bridging ligands. The one-dimensional chain is constructed by the coordination of a μ1,6-dmpzdo bridging ligand and Cu(II) ions. The data of the variable temperature (4–300 K) magnetic susceptibilities were fitted by using the one-dimensional chain fitting formula, which gave the magnetic coupling constants 2J = −98.88 cm−1.

Abstract

A novel one-dimensional coordination polymer [Cu(μ1,6-dmpzdo)(dmpzdo)2]⋅(ClO4)2 (dmpzdo = 2,5-dimethylpyrazine-1,4-dioxide) has been synthesized and its crystal structure determined by X-ray crystallography. In the complex each Cu1 atom is located in a square planar coordination environment with two oxygen atoms O2 and O2A from two dmpzdo terminal ligands, and two other oxygen atoms O3 and O3A from two μ1,6-dmpzdo bridging ligands. The one-dimensional chain is constructed by the coordination of a μ1,6-dmpzdo bridging ligand and Cu(II) ions. The data of the variable temperature (4-300 K) magnetic susceptibilities were fitted by using the one-dimensional chain fitting formula, which gave the magnetic coupling constants 2J = -98.88 cm-1.

In the complex each Cu1 atom is located in a square planar coordination environment with two oxygen atoms O2 and O2A from two dmpzdo terminal ligands, and two other oxygen atoms O3 and O3A from two μ1,6-dmpzdo bridging ligands. The one-dimensional chain is constructed by the coordination of a μ1,6-dmpzdo bridging ligand and Cu(II) ions. The data of the variable temperature (4–300 K) magnetic susceptibilities were fitted by using the one-dimensional chain fitting formula, which gave the magnetic coupling constants 2J = −98.88 cm−1.
cln_elements.clean_text:
Abstract

A novel one-dimensional coordination polymer [Cu(μ1,6-dmpzdo)(dmpzdo)2]⋅(ClO4)2 (dmpzdo = 2,5-dimethylpyrazine-1,4-dioxide) has been synthesized and its crystal structure determined by X-ray crystallography. In the complex each Cu1 atom is located in a square planar coordination environment with two oxygen atoms O2 and O2A from two dmpzdo terminal ligands, and two other oxygen atoms O3 and O3A from two μ1,6-dmpzdo bridging ligands. The one-dimensional chain is constructed by the coordination of a μ1,6-dmpzdo bridging ligand and Cu(II) ions. The data of the variable temperature (4-300 K) magnetic susceptibilities were fitted by using the one-dimensional chain fitting formula, which gave the magnetic coupling constants 2J = -98.88 cm-1.
